components.description:
A postal horn (post horn). Depicted as a coiled, valveless, brass horn, like a bugle or trumpet, with two red tassels. Sometimes used to mark announcements as well as for various content concerning brass instruments, music, or mail.

In the 18–19th centuries, post horns signaled the arrival of and cleared the way for mail coaches, like a modern-day siren. Used today as a symbol on postboxes (mailboxes) and by many European postal services, as seen featured in üè§ European Post Office.
components.title: Postal Horn

description:
A postal horn (post horn). Depicted as a coiled, valveless, brass horn, like a bugle or trumpet, with two red tassels. Sometimes used to mark announcements as well as for various content concerning brass instruments, music, or mail.

In the 18–19th centuries, post horns signaled the arrival of and cleared the way for mail coaches, like a modern-day siren. Used today as a symbol on postboxes (mailboxes) and by many European postal services, as seen featured in üè§ European Post Office.
title: Postal Horn

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Communication symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A postal horn (usually called a post horn)¬†was used in the 18th and 19th centuries to indicate that a mail coach was arriving to deliver the http://emojipedia.org/postal-horn/
emoji_net_data.name: postal horn

bn:00106584a: Containing or constituting or characterized by pleasing melody

bn:00106192a: Characterized by or producing sound of great volume or intensity

bn:00046965n: A musical instrument is an instrument created or adapted to make musical sounds.
A device constructed or modified with the purpose of making music.
Sound producing object used by a musician for this purpose
Any of various devices or contrivances that can be used to produce musical tones or sounds
A device, object, contrivance or machine used to produce musical notes or sounds.
A device designed to produce musical sounds
A device used to produce music.

bn:00022750n: A musician that plays the trumpet.
A musical instrument of the brass family, slightly smaller than a trumpet.
An instrument resembling a musical horn and used to signal others.
A brass instrument, or the sound it makes
A musician who plays the cornett
A musical instrument that consists of a flexible metal or bamboo tongue or reed attached to a frame.
A musical instrument in the brass family.
A trumpet is a musical instrument.
A musical instrument of the brass family, slightly smaller than a trumpet, usually in the musical key of B-flat.
The cornet is a brass instrument very similar to the trumpet, distinguished by its conical bore, compact shape, and mellower tone quality.
A musical instrument of the brass family, generally tuned to the key of B-flat.
A brass musical instrument with a brilliant tone; has a narrow tube and a flared bell and is played by means of valves

bn:00063763n: A type of brass horn used to signal the arrival or departure of a post rider or mail coach.
Wind instrument used by postilions of the 18th and 19th centuries
The post horn is a valveless cylindrical brass or copper instrument with cupped mouthpiece, used to signal the arrival or departure of a post rider or mail coach.
